summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence from 2019 to 2021 between defense attorney Joseph E. Nascimento and federal prosecutors (AUSAs) from the Southern District of New York (SDNY). The emails primarily concern scheduling meetings and interviews for Nascimento's client, who is cooperating with the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. The correspondence reveals ongoing cooperation, logistical planning for proffer sessions, and the client's status as a cooperating witness.

persons.name: Joseph E. Nascimento
persons.context: Attorney representing a client who is cooperating with the SDNY investigation into Epstein/Maxwell. He is scheduling meetings, proffers, and interviews with prosecutors on behalf of his client.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned in the context of her arrest in July 2020, which prompted Nascimento to check in with prosecutors about his client's status.

persons.name: Alan Ross
persons.context: Deceased former law partner of Joseph Nascimento. Mentioned as having represented a person (likely Nascimento's client) prior to his death in 2018.

connections.description: Nascimento's client is a cooperating witness in the investigation involving Maxwell, placing him in an adversarial legal relationship with Maxwell's defense.
Were law partners at the firm ROSS AMSEL RABEN NASCIMENTO, PLLC. Nascimento took over representation of Ross's former client after Ross's death.

events.title: Death of Alan Ross
events.description: Alan Ross, a former law partner of Joseph Nascimento, passed away.

events.title: Initial Contact and Meeting Scheduling
events.description: Joseph Nascimento initiates contact with SDNY prosecutors regarding his client's cooperation. Multiple emails are exchanged to schedule their first in-person meeting in West Palm Beach.

events.title: Scheduled Proffer Meeting
events.description: A proffer meeting with Nascimento's client is scheduled for September 10, 2019, at the Hilton in West Palm Beach.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell's Arrest
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell is arrested. Nascimento emails prosecutors to check on his client's status following the news.

events.title: Scheduled Video Conference Interview
events.description: A video conference interview with Nascimento's client is scheduled for May 14, 2021, at 12 p.m. via WebEx.

events.title: Proposed Meeting Date
events.description: Prosecutors propose a meeting for August 19 or 20, 2021, which Nascimento agrees to pending confirmation from agents.

locations: Hilton in West Palm Beach, 600 Okeechobee Blvd, West Palm Beach, FL
2250 S.W. 3rd Avenue, Miami, FL 33129 (Nascimento's law office)
keyFacts: Joseph Nascimento's client is a cooperating witness in the SDNY's Epstein/Maxwell investigation, and her cooperation status was affirmed by prosecutors as remaining unchanged.
The correspondence details extensive logistical planning for in-person proffer meetings and video interviews between 2019 and 2021, indicating a prolonged period of cooperation.
Nascimento's client was originally represented by his deceased former partner, Alan Ross, and Nascimento took over the representation, indicating a prior attorney-client relationship.
Prosecutors explicitly state they view the client's status positively and appreciate her assistance, indicating she is not a target.
The emails show the investigation was active and ongoing from at least mid-2019 through mid-2021, spanning the period before and after Ghislaine Maxwell's arrest.
